central_thesis: The text presents a comprehensive system for invoking and commanding various spirits (angelic and demonic) associated with the seven traditional planets, through the meticulous construction and consecration of specific magical pentacles inscribed with Divine Names, angelic intelligences, and scriptural verses, enabling the practitioner to achieve diverse magical outcomes from protection and wealth acquisition to invisibility and control over natural phenomena.

structure_content.summary: This section introduces the systematic classification of pentacles according to the seven traditional planets: Saturn (7 pentacles, black), Jupiter (7 pentacles, blue), Mars (7 pentacles, red), Sun (7 pentacles, yellow), Venus (5 pentacles, green), Mercury (5 pentacles, mixed colors), and Moon (6 pentacles, silver), outlining the fundamental organizational principle of the grimoire's practical magic.

Seven pentacles are dedicated to Saturn, primarily for striking terror into spirits, repressing pride, executing ruin and destruction, obtaining news from spirits, defending against invocations, chasing away treasure-guarding spirits, obsessing enemies, and exciting earthquakes. They incorporate Magical Characters of Saturn, Names of Angels (Omeliel, Anachiel, Arauchiah, Anazachia), Divine Names (YHVH, ADNI, IIAI, AHIH, Eloah), and versicles from Psalms (lxxii 9, cix 18, xviii 7) and Deuteronomy, with the SATOR AREPO TENET OPERA ROTAS square being a notable inclusion.

Seven pentacles are assigned to Jupiter, focusing on invoking spirits, acquiring glory, honors, riches, and tranquility of mind, discovering treasures, protecting invokers, commanding spirits, acquiring kingdom and empire, ensuring protection against dangers, and obtaining assured visions. They feature Mystical Characters of Jupiter, Names of Angels (Netoniel, Devachiah, Tzedeqiah, Parasiel, Bariel, Adoniel, Seraph, Kerub, Ariel, Tharsis, Chasan, Phorlakh, Taliahad), Divine Names (AHIH, AB, IHVH, IH), and versicles from Psalms (cxii 3, cxxv 1, cxvi 16-17) and Ezekiel i 1. Specific materials like silver are mentioned for engraving.

Seven pentacles consecrated to Mars are designed for invoking spirits of Mars, countering diseases, exciting war and hostility, resisting enemies, striking terror into rebellious spirits, ensuring victory in war, compelling demons, protection in combat, and causing hail and tempest. They include Mystical Characters of Mars, Names of Angels (Madimiel, Bartzachiah, Eschiel, Ithuriel), Divine Names (IHVH, IHShVH, Elohim, Shaddai, Agla, EL, Yiai), and versicles from Psalms (lxxvii 13, cx 5, xci 13, xxxvii 15) and Psalm cv 32-33. Specific writing materials like virgin parchment with bat blood are indicated for certain operations.

Seven pentacles dedicated to the Sun are intended to repress the pride of Solar Spirits, acquire kingdom, renown, and glory, enable the visibility of invisible spirits, facilitate rapid transportation, achieve invisibility, and deliver from imprisonment. They incorporate Mystical Characters of the Sun, Names of Angels (Shemeshiel, Paimoniah, Rekhodiah, Malkhiel), Divine Names (Shaddai, IHVH, Adonai), and versicles from Psalms (xiii 3-4, xci 11-12, lxix 23, cxxxv 16) and Genesis i 1. Engraving on gold on the day and hour of the Sun is specified for certain effects.

Five pentacles for Venus serve to control Venusian spirits, obtain grace, honor, and desires, attract love, compel individuals to come, and incite love. They feature Mystical Characters of Venus, Names of Angels (Nogahiel, Acheliah, Socodiah, Nangariel, Monachiel, Degaliel, Schii, Eli, Ayib), Divine Names (IHVH, Adonai, Ruach, Achides, Aegalmiel, Elohim, El Gebil), and versicles from Canticles viii 6, Genesis i 28, and Genesis ii 23-24. The emphasis is on love, attraction, and fertility.

Five pentacles for Mercury aim to invoke spirits under the Firmament, bring about effects contrary to natural order, acquire understanding and knowledge, penetrate hidden things, command 'Allatori' spirits, and open closed doors. They contain Mystical Characters of Mercury, Names of Spirits (Yekahel, Agiel, BÃ¶el), Names of Angels (Kokaviel, Gheoriah, Savaniah, Chokmahiel), Divine Names (EL, Ab, IHVH), and versicles from Psalm xxiv 7. The underlying theme is intellect, communication, and overcoming obstacles.

Six pentacles for the Moon are designed to invoke Moon spirits, open fastened doors, provide protection against water perils and tempests, protect during journeys, provide answers in sleep, destroy enemies, and cause heavy rains. They include Mystical Characters of the Moon, Names of Angels (Schioel, Vaol, Yashiel, Vehiel, Abariel, Iachadiel, Azarel, Yahel, Sophiel), Divine Names (IHVH, IHH, AL, Aub, Vevaphel, Eheieh Asher Eheieh, Elohim), and versicles from Psalms (cvii 16, lvi 11, xl 13, lxviii 1) and Genesis vii 11-12. Engraving on silver is specified for rain-making.

key_concepts.definition: A consecrated magical diagram or talisman, often circular, adorned with specific Divine Names, angelic names, symbols, and scriptural versicles, designed to attract, invoke, or compel particular spirits or planetary intelligences for a specific magical purpose.

Sacred Hebrew names of God (e.g., YHVH, ADNI, AHIH, EL, Elohim, Shaddai, Iah, Agla) whose inherent power and authority are used in pentacles to command and compel spirits into obedience, derived from Qabalistic traditions.

The proper names of specific angels (e.g., Omeliel, Parasiel, Bariel, Madimiel, Shemeshiel, Nogahiel, Yekahel, Schioel) associated with particular planets and pentacles, invoked for their specific virtues and roles in the magical system.

A short scriptural passage, typically from Psalms, Genesis, or Deuteronomy, inscribed on or around a pentacle. These verses are believed to activate or define the specific power and function of the pentacle, linking its operation to divine authority.

Unique symbolic glyphs or sigils, often derived from planetary energies or specific intelligences, that are incorporated into the design of pentacles to amplify their magical efficacy or represent hidden names and forces.

The practice of creating and empowering pentacles under the specific astrological influences (day and hour) of the planet to which they are consecrated. This alignment is crucial for drawing upon the correct cosmic energies and ensuring the pentacle's effectiveness for its designated purpose. Materials like silver for Jupiter or gold for the Sun are also part of this alignment.

A specific esoteric script or 'secret alphabet' used for inscribing certain names and characters on pentacles, especially for the Sun and Mercury, indicating a hidden or coded layer of magical potency beyond standard Hebrew characters.

practical_system.description: The practical system outlined in 'The Key of Solomon' revolves around the creation and ritualistic deployment of consecrated pentacles, each designed to harness specific planetary and angelic energies for diverse magical objectives. The efficacy of the operation is contingent upon precise adherence to the instructions, including the correct inscription of Divine and angelic names, specific planetary versicles, and the use of appropriate materials and timing (planetary days and hours). These pentacles act as focal points and instruments of command, compelling spirits to manifest and execute the magician's will.
tools: Pentacles (material objects like engraved metal plates or inscribed parchments)
Writing implements (e.g., pen of swallow, blood of screech-owl, blood of bat)
Magical Circle (implied for spirit evocation, explicitly mentioned for some operations)
Knowledge of Hebrew language and script
Magician's personal tools and regalia (implied by 'Master of Art')
rituals: Inscription of Pentacles: Drawing or engraving the specific figures, Divine Names, angelic names, and scriptural versicles onto appropriate materials (e.g., virgin parchment, silver, gold).
Planetary Timing: Performing the inscription and subsequent magical operations during the specific day and hour of the planet to which the pentacle is consecrated.

Material Selection: Using designated materials for pentacle construction (e.g., silver for Jupiter, gold for the Sun, virgin parchment, specific animal blood for Mars) to align with planetary energies.
Spirit Invocation/Evocation: Presenting the completed and consecrated pentacle to the spirits during invocation within a magical circle, using its inherent authority to compel obedience.
Recitation of Versicles: Chanting or repeating the associated scriptural versicles to activate the pentacle's power and reinforce the command over spirits.

Specific Applications: Employing pentacles in prescribed ways such as wearing them (for protection), placing them under water (for rain), or showing them to spirits (to cause terror or gain knowledge).

relevant_quotes.text: HERE FOLLOW THE HOLY PENTACLES, EXPRESSED IN THEIR PROPER FIGURES AND CHAR-ACTERS, TOGETHER WITH THEIR ESPECIAL VIRTUES; FOR THE USE OF THE MASTER OF ART.
The Ethiopians shall kneel before Him, His enemies shall lick the dust.
Wealth and Riches are in his house, and his righteousness endureth for ever.
My heart is like wax, it is melted in the midst of my bowels.
Then the earth shook and trembled, the foundations of the hills also moved and were shaken, because He was wroth.

critical_analysis.relevance: The Key of Solomon is a canonical grimoire, foundational to Western Esotericism and a primary source for ceremonial magic traditions. Its intricate system of planetary pentacles, precise use of Hebrew Divine Names and angelic intelligences, and incorporation of scriptural verses provide a detailed template for spirit evocation and talismanic magic. It is critically relevant for understanding the historical development of occult practices, the synthesis of Qabalistic principles with practical magic, and continues to influence modern magical practitioners seeking structured approaches to elemental and planetary work. Its systematic nature, although complex, offers a potent framework for those committed to rigorous ceremonial practice.
critical_analysis.target_audience: The primary target audience consists of advanced students and practitioners of Western Esotericism, ceremonial magicians, occult scholars, and individuals specifically interested in grimoire traditions and Solomonic magic. The text's explicit declaration 'for the use of the Master of Art' underscores its intended audience as experienced or dedicated practitioners who possess a foundational understanding of magical principles, Hebrew, and ritual practice.
